page.title: 08TOURISM
page.content: Only one tourist was discovered during the survey. He was from the Netherlands and was following Offa's Dyke, an ancient boundary, along the English / Welsh border. Local inhabitants said that there were many more{hikers}like the Dutch man who followed the Dyke on foot. There are no hotels in the area, although one house provides a{'bed and {breakfast'}service and snacks for hungry{campers.}In late June or early July a group of poor and under- privileged children from Birmingham come to camp in Pant-glas, faraway from the busy city.{Local visitors}to the area come for a quiet meal at the restaurant near Rhydycroesau which occupies a large house.
